titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 811) to reauthorize the independent counsel law for an additional 5 years, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E82)
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-419, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 811 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for the consideration of the bill in the Committee of the Whole. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill. Points of order against the committee amendment for failure to comply with provisions of the Budget Act shall be waived. Only those amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution shall be in order, to be considered in the manner specified in the report and not subject to further amendment except as specified. All points of order against the amendments shall be waived. After passage of the bill, it shall be in ...

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 133.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 249 - 174 (Roll no. 16).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 242 - 174 (Roll no. 17).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/8/1994--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 811 (reauthorizing the independent counsel law for an additional five years).
